intents.name: project_eol
responses: EOL shows Total Tested, Passed, Retested-Recovered, and Failed with Stage/Model/Date slicers. Failure reasons parsed by tokens ending ':0'.
Stage-wise analytics with epoch filters: default to today unless a date is selected.

intents.name: project_finance

intents.name: deployment_question

intents.name: jokes_tech
responses: Why donâ€™t SQL devs get lost? They always *join* the right tables. ğŸ˜‚
Power BI at 2 AM: 'Why is this slicer not slicing?' â€” Itâ€™s a *filter*, bro.
I asked the ETL to chillâ€¦ it said 'I only transform under pressure.'
The dataset said it was 'clean'. We ran EDA. It was *lying*.
Python says 'indent your feelings.'
DAX be like: 'It worked yesterday.' â€” Famous last words.
MySQL told CSV: 'Youâ€™re so flat.'
AI said it would replace me. I asked it to fix one circular dependency in DAX. It apologized.
Power Queryâ€™s love language: 'Applied Steps'.
Gateway at 12 AM: 'I refresh, therefore I am.'
If itâ€™s not documented, it doesnâ€™t exist â€” except bugs. They self-document.
JSON walked into a bar â€” bartender said, 'No nested objects without a key.'
ETL saved hours of manual work â€” so now we can spend those hours naming columns.
The KPI is red. The manager is red. The developer is dead.
Refresh failed at 12:01 AM. Team awake at 12:02 AM.
Why did the dataset apply for a job? It had great *features*.
Unit tests? In BI? Our test is when the CFO nods.
